course.subject: MATH
course.name: Mathematical Methods in Science and Engineering I
course.description: Modeling and analytical solution methods of nonlinear partial differential equations (PDEs). Topics include: derivation of conservation laws and constitutive equations, well-posedness, traveling wave solutions, method of characteristics, shocks and rarefaction solutions, weak solutions to hyperbolic equations, hyperbolic Systems, linear stability analysis, weakly nonlinear approximation, similarity methods, calculus of variations.

reviews.author: YS
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly (except the variation calculus) available as Ch. 1 to 6 from "An Introduction to Nonlinear Partial Differential Equations" by David Logan, while the variation calculus (after Ch. 5) was taught using Euler-Lagrange equations and energy methods with pretty specific examples.

Maybe the course content is more theoretical (e.g. the derivations of Burgers' equations using weakly nonlinear approximations takes 1 lesson to talk about) than the title suggests, the class is pretty small and even only 10 people took this course this semester.

Also no coding in this course. Once I tried plotting the characteristics using Octave and got big X on the figures because Prof. Xiang expected hand drawing. Boo.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Xiang simply went thru the textbook content, sometimes with a bit more details on e.g. how the derivation is done. Usually he showed the slides, speak a few sentences and gave us time to jot/cap the content, then next slide and repeat the process, and lessons were done. In case you can understand the book content by yourself, skip most lessons. Go to the seminars or workshops instead to fulfill the graduation requirement.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 30%
Attendance (?) 10%
Final 60%

Not very sure about the attendance stuff because I didn't see it on Canvas or remember Prof. Xiang mentioned it. Other than that the grading seems to be quite good (esp. having had a degree in the same uni). Both assignments and final around mean and I got an A. Big thanks.

Pay more attention to Ch. 2 to 5 plus the (derivation of the) Euler-Lagrange equations would be good for your grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Each assignment took me a week to finish even tho I got a quite helpful classmate. Also since final is open book, I'm not sure what he would test so it takes me quite some time to include everything and know that he only asked up to Ch. 5.

reviews.author: zzayron
reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.comment_content: Very formal introduction to PDE, you will know the general classification of PDE, including hyperbolic, elliptic and parabolic. Also, you will learn basic analytical tools such as characteristic methods, similarity solution, small parameter expansion to analyze the property and behavior of PDE. Generally, it is a introductory course for PDE analysis.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof xiang will derive all the formula step by step, and you will not get lost if you just follow every step.
reviews.comment_grading: Professor will grade all the homework themselves and point out your fault.
reviews.comment_workload: It is fairly good, about 2 questions per week, just for you to review knowledge.
